title: 108_s822
content: The "Child Care Lending Pilot Act of 2003" may be cited as the short title for this Act. It establishes a Child Care Business Loan Program. The Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended to authorize loans with restrictions and limitations. The use of proceeds is specified, including loans to small, non-profit child care businesses. The Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended to authorize loans for small, non-profit child care businesses, subject to specific conditions. The Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended to allow financial assistance for non-profit child care businesses, meeting eligibility requirements for for-profit businesses. The Small Business Administration must submit reports on the program implementation every 6 months. The House of Representatives requires reports on the implementation of child care small business loans, including dates and loan details. The Comptroller General of the United States must submit a report on these loans to specific Senate committees by March 31, 2006. The report on child care small business loans must be submitted to specific Senate committees by March 31, 2006. It should include information on the loan program's implementation, effectiveness, participation, marketing, and number of small businesses involved. The report on child care small business loans, due by March 31, 2006, should detail the ease of participation in the loan program by Certified Development Companies, lenders, and small businesses. It should also cover the marketing strategies used, the number of businesses that applied, were approved, and received loan disbursements, categorized by for-profit/non-profit and new/expanded businesses. Additionally, it should include the number of businesses in each state and the total amount loaned. The Administrator of the Small Business Administration will issue final rules for the loan program authorized by the Small Business Investment Act of 1958. The amendments made by this section will be in effect until September 30, 2006, applying to all loans made during this period.
